rules.subject:
[C0808][misra-c2012-10.1]: Violation of MISRA C:2012 Rule 10.1: Operands shall not be of an inappropriate essential type
The left operand of the & operator is of an inappropriate essential type category signed.
The right operand of the & operator is of an inappropriate essential type category signed.
[C0806][misra-c2012-10.3]: Violation of MISRA C:2012 Rule 10.3: The value of an expression shall not be assigned to an object with a narrower essential type or of a different essential type category

violations.code:
40| void implicit_conversion(void)
41| {
> 42|     unsigned int u = -1;  /* Implicit signed to unsigned conversion */
43|     signed char c = 256;  /* Out of range */
44|     int sum = u + c;      /* Mixed signed/unsigned math */

rules.subject: [C0805][misra-c2012-10.4]: Violation of MISRA C:2012 Rule 10.4: Both operands of an operator in which the usual arithmetic conversions are performed shall have the same essential type category

violations.code:
42|     unsigned int u = -1;  /* Implicit signed to unsigned conversion */
43|     signed char c = 256;  /* Out of range */
> 44|     int sum = u + c;      /* Mixed signed/unsigned math */
45| }
46|

rules.subject: [C0605][misra-c2012-12.1]: Violation of MISRA C:2012 Rule 12.1: The precedence of operators within expressions should be made explicit

[C1604][misra-c2012-13.3]: Violation of MISRA C:2012 Rule 13.3: A full expression containing an increment (++) or decrement (--) operator should have no other potential side effects other than that caused by the increment or decrement operator

violations.code:
21| 
22|     /* Rule 14.1, 14.2: complex expression with side effects */
> 23|     ret_val = (input++ + (g_counter *= 2)) / 0; /* Division by zero to trigger potential false positive */
24| 
25|     /* Rule 15.2: goto usage */
